intro: Malabathris cyanoides, commonly known as the blue spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually alternate and have a succulent texture, while its stems are often hairy. Malabathris cyanoides is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display.
